module.name: FreePBX Framework
module.changelog: *12.0.1alpha37* Update framework DB to have helper functions for functions that mysqli needs *12.0.1alpha36* Revert Use mysqli extension for database access, if available. *12.0.1alpha35* #7141 Use mysqli extension for database access, if available. *12.0.1alpha34* Remove need for jqueryUI buttonset on browsers with CSS3 native support *12.0.1alpha33* Change security shield functionality, add advanced setting to disable nightly update checking *12.0.1alpha32* Add Japanese language support *12.0.1alpha31* FREEPBX-7119 *12.0.1alpha30* #7168 and CSS Updates *12.0.1alpha29* Enable Less Support *12.0.1alpha28* Ensure module hooks aren't duplicated. *12.0.1alpha26* Move BMO Startup to enable proper module integration *12.0.1alpha25* BMO issues with Commercial Modules *12.0.1alpha24* Minor BMO cleanups *12.0.1alpha22* #7123 SECURITY ISSUE introduced in 2.9 *12.0.1alpha18* #6471 Allow better voicemail passwords *12.0.1alpha17* Set CustomPresence on dynamic hints, when available. *12.0.1alpha16* Added help text bubbles to feature code admin re FREEPBX-6903 *12.0.1alpha15* Add remote-unlock feature. This is disabled by default. *12.0.1alpha14* Remove unneeded warning when processing commercial modules. *12.0.1alpha13* Automatically enable repos from module_admin if used with --repo also make standard, standard *12.0.1alpha12* Full fix for module_admin functionality to always attempt to look at master modulexml for list of repos *12.0.1alpha11* BMO didn't know how to preload a module. *12.0.1alpha10* Update to 10, numerous fixes here and there *12.0.1alpha9* And then there was 9, set the Version of FreePBX correctly *12.0.1alpha8* BMO fixes and other things that make this awesome *12.0.1alpha7* Prep for public release 1 *12.0.1alpha6* Update Global SIP Settings Driver Selection *12.0.1alpha5* More Module Admin tweaks and fixes *12.0.1alpha4* Module Admin Javascript bugs fixed *12.0.1alpha3* Module Admin working. Might have some bugs. *12.0.1alpha2* Good start to the first alpha, forgot to package the new javascripts
module.description: This module provides a facility to install bug fixes to the framework code that is not otherwise housed in a module
